author: mrmitch
title: Jack Stone is meant for 4-7 year olds!
review: These sets have few pieces so they can be put together quickly and easily. Its a vehicle that rolls well and has the cool blue flame. All of the Jack Stone line and the 4+ series have figures that are 2" tall not the standard 1 1/2" tall. Almost all of the J Stone sets we have were bought on clearance here and there. Not a bad set if you are pleasing a child in the age group listed above.

author: Yoda____
title: aargh
review: None of the Jack Stone sets have bothered me that much so far but why is a fireman driving a convertible and why does he use a water pistol. It still has the same flaw and advantage that i've said so many times i'm not even going to bother to type again. This one is probably the worst Jack Stone set I have.

author: BobaFett2
title: I think a 4 year old should be able to build...
review:
As with all of the Jack Stone sets, this is overprice, overjuniorized, and not so well designed. I really don't see how a 4-year old shouldn't be able to build. Or a 7 year old.

Box/Instructions

It shows the cruiser driving down a street with cartoony buildings in the background. Nice setup. There's a neat little comic on the last page.

Parts

The best part here is the front piece. It's a printed 3x4 slope. Very nice. There's two printed TECHNIC pieces, as well as a water piece. Other parts are pretty inconsequential.

Minifigures

You get a large Fire Chief. It can't be taken apart-while nicely designed, it's too large to be useful (takes up too much space) in small vehicles and just not worth that much.

The build

It's dull. They can fit it into less than one page.

The completed model

Nothing more than dull. It's not very well designed. I don't know how this sold.

Summary

I still hate this theme. It's nearly useless for parts, has annoying figures, and no build whatsoever. And it taught kids that you could make "good" buildings by sticking together beams and placing these odd parts in them, and "good" cars by just sticking on attachments.
